ai_page.title: Apply to make change to a council flat - Plymouth - Page
ai_page.body:
Planning and building control

  • Planning applications Apply for planning permission, find and comment on existing planning applications, report alleged unauthorised development, information on applications and fees
  • Building control Apply for building regulations approval, book a site inspection, report dangerous structures, information on building control applications, fees and charges
  • Planning policy and guidance Includes the Plymouth and South West Devon Joint Local Plan, policy documents, design guidance, monitoring and delivery and planning policy archives
  • Neighbourhood planning Information on the different initiatives available to local communities to improve their area, including neighbourhood forums and plans and the City Change Fund
  • Community Infrastructure Levy Information on the Community Infrastructure Levy (CIL), including liability, rates, deductions, reliefs, exemptions and the Annual Infrastructure Funding Statement
  • Design, conservation and heritage Includes information on urban design, the High Street Heritage Action Zone, listed buildings, conservation areas, ancient monuments, historic parks and archaeology
  • Trees and hedges Apply to work on a protected tree, view the weekly list of tree applications, report a problem with a tree and view information about how we look after trees and hedges
  • The Plymouth Plan Read our ground-breaking plan which looks ahead to 2034, view our progress in the annual report or use the interactive plan to view the different elements of the plan
  • Our planning awards View the planning awards and achievements we have won for work that we have either led on or where our teams have made a positive contribution to other organisations
  • Planning consultations Take part in our planning consultations and give us your thoughts, opinions and comments to have your say and influence decisions before we agree them
  • Response to the Planning Reforms View our formal responses to the Government’s proposals to streamline and modernise the planning process.
  • Plymouth Regeneration Forum View the minutes of the Plymouth Regeneration Forum which includes membership from key investors, landowners and other development stakeholders in the city
  • Planning films and videos View some of the films and videos we have created for housing, transport, nature and the environment, Plymouth Energy Community and the City Change Fund

Related Content

  • Parks, nature and green spaces
  • City Change Fund
  • Plymouth and South West Devon Joint Local Plan
  • Travel Plans
  • Abercrombie Awards
  • Invest in Plymouth: Key developments

ai_feedback.title: Apply to make change to a council flat - Plymouth - Feedback

feedback.Did the text answer your query?: No, the page content is about planning and building control, not about requesting permission for flat improvements or how to apply for changes to my flat.
feedback.Was there anything that could have been: Yes, it wasn't clear how to start a simple online request for flat modifications or how to find specific guidance for council tenants like me.
feedback.Is there any way this text could be impr: Including a straightforward link or section specifically for tenants wanting to request small home improvements, with step-by-step instructions and expected timelines, would make it much clearer.

text_issues.improvement: This page should specifically highlight how tenants can request small improvements to their flats, like installing a new kitchen or handrail. It should include a clear link or section dedicated to flat upgrade requests, with simple, step-by-step instructions and estimated timelines.
text_issues.why: The current content is about broad planning topics and does not directly address tenants' needs for straightforward guidance on flat modifications. Providing targeted, clear instructions will help tenants like David understand how to easily make their requests and reduce confusion.

text_issues.Issue: The feedback indicates the text isn't clear about how to start a simple online request for flat modifications or find specific guidance for council tenants.

text_issues.improvement: Use simple, everyday language to explain the process. For example, ‘Want to improve your flat? Fill out our easy online form, upload photos or plans, and you’ll hear back within a few weeks.’ This makes the information accessible and less intimidating.
text_issues.why: The current text is technical and could be overwhelming or confusing for tenants seeking straightforward guidance. Clear, simple language improves understanding and encourages users to take action.
